qas.question: How long has Carnival been celebrated?
Under whose rule was Carnival established in the 16th century?
Dionysus was a deity in whose tradition?
In what century did the Carnival become an organized event?
What city almost exclusively celebrates the Carnival?

context: Carnival has been celebrated for <a0_0>centuries<a0_0/>. The tradition was likely established under <a1_0>Venetian<a1_0/> rule around the 16th century. It may have been influenced by <a2_0>Greek<a2_0/> traditions, such as festivities for deities such as Dionysus. The celebration originally involved dressing in costumes and holding masked balls or visiting friends. In the <a3_0>twentieth<a3_0/> century it became an organized event held during the 10 days preceding Lent (according to the Greek Orthodox calendar). The festival is celebrated almost exclusively in the city of <a4_0>Limassol<a4_0/>.
